Lore: One of the most profitable occupations in the galaxy is hunting down and capturing wanted beings. The more notable the quarry, the more profitable the venture.

Information: The real strategy with the Bounty card will come out through careful placement of sites and using docking bays to provide a means of moving the hunters and captives between systems.\par To pull off the combo of both collecting a Bounty and then freezing the captive, the Dark Side player would do well to place the Cloud City: Carbonite Chamber as close to the Cloud City: Security Tower as possible.\par Finally, it is pretty likely that the Cloud City: East Platform (Docking Bay) should also go in that line. That way, a turn can go like this: docking bay transit to (or better yet, land Slave I at) the East Platform. Take a Lift Tube to the Security Tower and retrieve the Bounty. Walk next door to the Carbonite Chamber with all your little Ugnaught friends and have Han ready for freezing next control phase.

Lore: Chewie's life debt to Han forced him to act, retaliating unexpectedly against his captors.
Gametext: USED: Cancel Force drain bonus from IT-O this turn. LOST: During your battle phase, any of your escorted captives at same site may initiate and participate in one battle (they may not use weapons or devices and you may not voluntarily forfeit or relocate them).
IsPulled: Corellian Retort
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-3)\par When using this Light Side interrupt, the captive is temporarily placed on the Light Side of the site (even if enclosed) to participate normally in this battle. This relocation does not count as being 'released'. If you have other characters at the same site they also participate in this battle (where applicable). All normal battling conditions must be observed. For example, characters can participate in only one battle per turn and presence is required on both sides of the location. For this reason, if the captive is a droid (or the escort is a droid, for example IG- 88 With Riot Gun) and no other ability is being provided, then the battle would end immediately. If the original escorting character and the captive (who was not captured or sent missing during the battle) survive, then the captive is returned to being escorted by that character at the end of the battle.
Cancels: Force drain bonus from IT-O (Eyetee-Oh) and IT-O (Eyetee-Oh) (V3).

Lore: Officer from Kalist VI. Due to a political blunder, was stripped of most official duties. Relegated to shuttling dignitaries and high-ranking Imperials.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Your shuttling, landing and taking off to or from same location is free. During your control phase may take one Lambda shuttle or Landing Craft into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: Lobot's direct link with the Cloud City central computer allowed him to efficiently manipulate the floating city's resources.
Gametext: USED: Cancel Limited Resources. LOST: Use 2 Force (free if Lobot on table) to examine the top card of your Reserve Deck, Force Pile and Used Pile. Return one of those three cards to the top of each deck or pile.
Information: Stacks the top card of each pile - put a high destiny number on your Reserve Deck, put a card you need on your Force Pile so that you can draw it.

Lore: Despite being alone, trapped and desperately outmatched, Luke continued his battle with the Dark Lord of the Sith.
Gametext: One of your Skywalkers present during a battle at a site, for remainder of turn, loses immunity to attrition but adds ability to power (he or she may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny). OR During a duel, add one destiny to your total.
Information: If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)
Combo: Courage Of A Skywalker + Draw Their Fire + Treva Home (Psychobabble)

Lore: Imperial recruits are repeatedly assured that small cracks between the plates of their armor pose little risk from baster fire. Their first day of battle often tells a different story.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. Any card which is 'hit' may not be used to satisfy attrition. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: (Non-lightsaber) weapon helper card.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Biotech's latest model, the Aj^g, boasts greater storage capacity than all other models combined. Advertised as, "Artificial intelligence worth shaving your head for."
Gametext: Deploy on an alien of ability < 3. Each turn, you may 'store' one card from hand face-down here. Holds up to three cards (six on Lobot). You may play or deploy cards from here as if from hand. Place stored cards in Used Pile if device lost or removed from character.
IsPulled: BoShek (V1)\par Corporal Beezer\par Lobot (V6)\par Panic (V2)\par Portable Scanner\par Rycar Ryjerd (V2)
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-5)\par If your opponent takes control of your Cyborg Construct, any cards underneath it are placed on top of your Used Pile.

Lore: "The Force is with you, young Skywalker. But you are not a Jedi yet."
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle, you may do one of the following: Add one destiny to your total power only. OR If you have a character weapon present, select one opponent's character present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.

Lore: "Perhaps you think you're being treated unfairly?" "No." "Good. It would be unfortunate if I had to leave a garrison here."
Gametext: Deploy on Bespin: Cloud City if you control that sector and at least three related sites. At each Cloud City site, your total power is +4 and your Force drains are +2. Effect canceled if opponent occupies four Bespin locations. (Immune to Alter.)

Lore: Many have experienced the awesome power of the Dark Lord in battle. Few have lived to tell about it.
Gametext: If you just targeted with a lightsaber, add 3 to your weapon destiny. OR Cancel Swing-And-A-Miss. OR Lose 1 Force to cause one opponent's character just 'hit' to be immediately placed in Lost Pile.
Information: Combo Card: Sniper & Dark Strike
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-5)\par This Interrupt adds 3 to the total weapon destiny for a lightsaber, not 3 to each destiny draw.

Lore: See Luke run. Run, Luke, run!
Gametext: Use 2 Force to increase a character's or creature vehicle's landspeed by 1 for remainder of turn. OR Use 3 Force to move one of your characters as a 'react' (free if character is a scout).

Lore: The carbonite froze more than just Han's body.
Gametext: If a Rebel was just captured or 'frozen,' deploy on another Rebel. That Rebel may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny (if Leia, she is also excluded from being the "highest-ability character"). If captive released, lose Immediate Effect.

Cancels: Imperial Barrier\par The Shield Doors Must Be Closed

Lore: Normally parents try to prevent their children from falling down the stairs.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, A-5)\par Some versions of this Interrupt were misprinted. The misprints play the same as the correct copies, which end with "... move that character away as a 'react' (for free)."

Lore: Having lost sight of Boba Fett, Luke was surprised by his sudden reappearance.
Gametext: If a bounty hunter is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve one bounty hunter from your Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take one bounty hunter into hand and reshuffle.

Lore: "How rude!"

Lore: Brought to Cloud City by the Empire. Facilitates Imperial-to-alien communication. Relayed carbonite chamber modification instructions to Ugloste. Arrogant. Rude. Vulgar.
Gametext: Total power at same site is +1 for each of your alien/Imperial pairs present. Once during every turn, may use 1 Force to 'insult' one opponent's droid present (except R2-D2), canceling that droid's game text for remainder of turn.
IsPulled: Look Sir, Droids (V15)

Lore: "Join me, and together we can rule the galaxy as father and son."
Gametext: USED: During a battle at a site, instead of firing one character weapon, cause one opponent's character present to be power -4 until end of turn. LOST: During a battle at a site, use 3 Force to cancel one battle destiny just drawn.

Deploy on your side of table. The Circle Is Now Complete or Vader's Obsession may be played to initiate an epic duel as follows: If Vader is present with specified target, each player draws two destiny (add 1 to each destiny draw if using a lightsaber). Add character's ability.\par If \b Vader\b0  loses, place him out of play. You lose 6 Force (9 if dueling Luke).\par If \b Obi-Wan\b0  loses, place him out of play. Opponent loses 9 Force.\par If \b Luke\b0  loses, opponent must choose: Cross Luke to the Dark Side and lose X Force, where X = Luke's ability. OR Lose Luke and lose triple X Force.
Information: There are other cards that impact Epic Duel such as Focused Attack, Glancing Blow, Armed And Dangerous and NOOOOOOOOOOOO! among others. These cards add a little more unpredictability to duels and don't make things a foregone conclusion.\par -----\par Lord Vader (V11) - Using Epic Duel, The Circle Is Now Complete may target any Jedi instead of Obi-Wan.

Lore: "Aaaaah!"
Gametext: At the end of a battle that you won at an interior site where you have a character of ability > 3 present, relocate one opponent's character present to an adjacent site. (If on Cloud City, character may be relocated to Weather Vane instead.)

Lore: Luke had a falling out with his estranged father.
Gametext: If you just lost a character during a battle or a duel at a Cloud City site, use 2 Force to relocate that character to Weather Vane instead of your Lost Pile. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take one Weather Vane into hand and reshuffle.
Pulls: Weather Vane\par Weather Vane (V6)

Lore: "Rather touchy, aren't they?"
Gametext: During your move phase, if you have at least two combat vehicles at same cloud sector, relocate one starfighter present to a related docking bay or system. OR If one of your combat vehicles is defending a battle at a cloud sector, add one battle destiny.

Lore: Not since his duel with Obi-Wan had Vader unleashed the raw power of the dark side.
Gametext: If Vader is present during a battle at a site, for remainder of turn, he loses his immunity to attrition, but adds ability to power (he may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny). OR During a duel, add one destiny to your total.

Lore: Han was fast. Vader was faster.
Gametext: USED: Cancel an attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon. LOST: If one of your characters was just targeted by a weapon during a battle, use 3 Force to cancel the targeting.
Cancels: An attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon.\par Targeting of a character by a weapon.

Lore: "You will not deviate from your present course. . . Permission granted to land on platform three-two-seven."
Gametext: Deploy on a docking bay. Target an opponent's starfighter at the related system or a related cloud sector. Target may not move away from Utinni Effect. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.

Lore: Molten carbonite is released into the chamber and then flash frozen, releasing a blast of air. The subject is instantly covered in the newly solidified material.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. At every site where there is a 'frozen' captive, your Rebels deploy -2 and are power +2 in battle. OR Deploy on top of opponent's Force Pile. Force below this card may not be drawn or used. Effect lost at end of opponent's next turn.

(However, Shasa may not reorder a card from below Frozen Assets to above it, or vice versa.)\par

Lore: Works every time.

Gametext: If you have a character with a lightsaber present in a battle with Vader, lose 1 Force to reduce Vader's power to zero. OR If you have a character with a lightsaber in a duel, cancel one opponent's destiny draw immediately after it is revealed.

Lore: After pursuit, asteroids, a slug, Jedi training, capture, torture, escape, a duel, losing Han and losing a hand, Luke and Leia finally made it to the Alliance's rendezvous point.
Gametext: Deploy on Rendezvous Point, Hoth, Yavin 4, Alderaan or Sullust. Your starships deploy -2 and your pilots deploy -1 here. When battling here, you may add one battle destiny. Effect canceled if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)

Gametext: USED: Cancel Captive Pursuit. LOST: During your move phase, transfer an escorted captive to another bounty hunter or warrior present.

Lore: The Cloud City chasm's central fin was engineered with a tensile strength unsurpassed by anything in the region, save the silk of the Kashyyyk treeworm.

Lore: Former warrant officer from Concord Dawn. Promoted due to superb performance. Specializes in transporting high-profile criminals. Twin brother of a famous mercenary.
Gametext: During your control phase, may use 1 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take one Human Shield into hand and reshuffle. When escorting a captive, captive is forfeit +2 and Sheckil is immune to attrition < 4.
Information: You've captured a group of Rebels and are escorting them to the Cloud City: Security Tower to do mean and nasty things to them. (OK, most of those things involve Force losses and torture with creepy devices, but still, that's pretty mean!) Heading down the Cloud City: Upper Plaza Corridor you're just about there, when suddenly the Light Side sets up an ambush. Things are looking bad as the Light Side wins a spectacular battle, but they overlooked one thing. You've got Lieutenant Sheckil. You play the interrupt Human Shield using its lost game text. Now any captive present may be forfeited to meet the attrition and battle loss. Lieutenant Sheckil adds 2 to any captive he is escorting, so you can easily meet the battle loss and attrition. Guess it wasn't such a good idea to attack!\par \par Lieutenant Sheckil is an expert at escorting captives. He's also an expert at protecting the Dark Side from harm by using captives as shields. During your control phase, you may use 1 Force to take one Human Shield into hand from the Reserve Deck. Sheckil also adds 2 to the forfeit value of any captive he escorts. To take full advantage of him, you absolutely need the card Human Shield. This card in a Used form allows you to use captives as target fodder for your opponent's weapons. As a Lost Interrupt, you can use those captives he's escorting to meet battle damage and attrition, thus saving your own forces.
Pulls: Human Shield
IsPulled: Blizzard 4\par Blizzard 4 (V6)\par Commander Daine Jir (V6)
Combo: Lieutenant Sheckil + Human Shield + Binders
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, A-11)\par The name "Sumner" in this card's game text is a misprint and should read "Sheckil".

Information: This weapon works well in a deck that relies on personal weapons to give bonuses. While Luke carries this weapon, Princess Leia is free to use Anakin's Lightsaber. The advantage of this card is that it does not even need to hit a character to have some nice bonuses, just target them.\par \par The deploy cost can be a little high when compared with the personal sabers, but the advantage is that Luke's pistol will work a little more consistently in having its most powerful effect then the sabers will when facing high ability characters. Additionally, with a number of four destiny cards in the deck, pretty much everyone is vulnerable to this except Vader, Fett and IG-88.

Lore: Contains wrist lasers, rocket dart launchers, a flame projector, a projectable grappling hook, a concussion grenade launcher, four kinds of sensors and a broad band antenna.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any alien or Imperial (except Vader or Boba Fett). Character is power +2, has armor = 5 and is immune to attrition < 3.
Information: It's a dangerous universe, and your characters need all the protection they can get. Blasters, Bowcasters even Lightsabers are constant hazards. What's the best way to protect them? Put them in a set of Armor. That's where Mandalorian Armor comes in.\par In a word, Wow! This one device gives your valuable character the characteristics of everyone's favorite bounty hunter. Give your opponent something else to target with that armor of 5. Immunity to attrition is always a bonus, not to mention the power +2. Imagine Grand Moff Tarkin protected by armor 5, canceling battle destiny with his buddy Vader. Tarkin will no longer be Lightsaber bait! How about everyone's favorite Jawa, Dathcha, running around at power 4 with immunity to attrition of less than 3. Or, if you're into raw power, how about throwing Kitik Keed'kak into Mandalorian Armor. Power 10, immunity to attrition of less than 3 and armor to protect that ability of 1!

Lore: In a military situation, on a regional or galactic scale, commands sometimes get misinterpreted. A local commander giving orders is far more reliable.
Gametext: Cancel Demotion, Restricted Deployment, Commence Recharging, Logistical Delay, They're On Dantooine, Asteroid Sanctuary, Scramble, Order To Engage, No Disintegrations, Asteroids Do Not Concern Me, Report To Lord Vader or What Is Thy Bidding, My Master?
Information: This card is a more specific counter than the general purpose Alter. With the addition to the play environment of cards like Control and Do Or Do Not/There Is No Try, specific counters are likely to start gaining in popularity.\par \par For a Dark Side primarily ground deck (such as a bounty hunting deck or a Walker Garrison deck), the specific counters might be a very good direction to head in. Point Man can cancel some of the cards that can really give these decks headaches, especially Asteroid Sanctuary. It can also be advantageous to cancel Scramble. Order To Engage, and No Disintegrations in a deck of this type.\par \par Point Man can be combined with Boring Conversation Anyway in a deck designed to hamper a Sense/Alter strategy with the Tentacle/Control tactic. This will allow a measure of counter card advantage.
Combo: Point Man + Boring Conversation Anyway + Tentacle
Cancels: Asteroid Sanctuary\par Asteroids Do Not Concern Me\par Asteroids Do Not Concern Me (V5)\par Commence Recharging\par Demotion\par Demotion (V2)\par Logistical Delay\par Logistical Delay (V3)\par No Disintegrations!\par No Disintegrations! (V5)\par Order To Engage\par Report To Lord Vader\par Restricted Deployment\par Scramble\par They're On Dantooine\par What Is Thy Bidding, My Master?

Lore: Coolant emitted by the TCF32 Carbonite Encasement Apparatus is rumored to have a mildly euphoric effect on Ugnaughts. Individuals on TCF32 duty are regarded with envy.
Gametext: USED: Add 2 to Carbon Freezing destiny. LOST: If one of your Ugnaughts is defending in a battle, add one battle destiny.
Information: This card has a couple of uses, which complement each other nicely. If you're building a Carbon Freezing deck, this is a quick and convenient way to get a +2 on your destiny draw. A few other modifiers, and you'll be freezing everything that walks into the Carbonite Chamber.\par \par Even if you're not playing a Carbon Freezing deck, this card can obviously benefit from the presence of Ugnaughts. Unlike most "defending" cards, this does not require your Ugnaught to be alone, so if you have an Ugnaught and 3 other ability present, you can get two destiny draws. Plus, their ability to get weapons and devices from your Lost Pile to your *hand* makes Ugnaughts useful even in a non-Carbon Freezing deck. And, if you are playing Carbon Freezing, you'll want plenty of Ugnaughts anyway. You might find yourself using both versions of Prepare the Chamber in the same game.
IsPulled: Carbonite Chamber Console
Combo: Prepare the Chamber + Carbonite Chamber Console + 3 Ugnaughts + Carbon Freezing

And this version certainly packs a punch!\par \par Gone is the spy skill, but that's OK, she has other priorities now. She can pilot starships and vehicles adding 1 to power. She does have a deployment restriction, but it is a pretty good variety. She may also deploy as a "react" to Hoth or Cloud City if Han or Luke are there. She may also move as a react to their site.\par \par Probably the biggest change in Princess Leia is the ability 4. Yes, that's right, Leia can now use Anakin's Lightsaber. Another bonus, Leia can step in for Son Of Skywalker and Jedi train. With her Reflection, Leia tests as if she were ability 5. This leaves your Son Of Skywalker free to right the wrongs of the universe and face Darth Vader on Cloud City!

Lore: "Luke." "Father." "Son, come with me."
Gametext: Cancel Anger, Fear, Aggression when it is inserted or revealed. OR If your opponent just initiated a battle or Force drain, opponent must choose to use 2 Force, or cancel that battle or Force drain.

Lore: "Chewie, this won't help me. Hey! Save your strength. There'll be another time. The princess...you have to take care of her."
Gametext: If Leia and Chewie are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If Leia is participating in a battle, you may lose Chewie from hand to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you. OR Cancel I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee or Frustration.
Information: Protector, like Old Pirates, presents a new twist on the traditional "teamwork" cards, such as Don't Get Cocky and Gift Of The Mentor. Like the traditional cards, this may be played when you have Leia and Chewie together in a battle. Your benefit is 2 added battle destiny. This is an impressive twist, as all other of the destiny-adding teamwork cards involve Luke. In a Teamwork-based deck, this can surprise an opponent who expects these powerful interrupts only from combinations involving Luke. And no one can deny the power of an extra 2 destiny in a battle, especially in a high destiny deck, as a Teamwork deck tends to be.\par \par The extra text is quite useful. In fact, I'd venture to say that it is the most powerful yet. It allows you, if Leia is in a battle, to forfeit Chewie from your hand to satisfy all battle damage and attrition. This is quite nasty in conjunction with a few other cards. Obviously, you can use this to keep a squad of characters on the Death Star while your opponent is forced to lose some of his built up defense, but there are more subtle strategies.\par \par One is an odd twist on the familiar Ghhhk strategy. One would play a lone TIE Fighter at a system and drain. When the opponent deployed there, he would play a Lone Pilot and then Ghhhk to avoid the damage. You can do something similar with this, and, in fact, the effect is much more devastating. With Princess Leia on the table, if you play Warrior's Courage, you get 3 battle destiny when she's alone. Then, simply play Protector, and lose Chewie, and she stays on the table. Doubly effective if she's been trained, or if she's carrying a Lightsaber.\par \par The added cancelling ability can be useful as well, cancelling two very annoying interrupts. Frustration can be a pain in a deck designed for it, and cancelling I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee can be an added reassurance that your cards are going to get into play.
IsPulled: Chewbacca (V3)
Combo: Leia + Han + Chewie + Obi-Wan + Luke + Skywalkers + Don't Get Cocky + Protector + Gift Of The Mentor + Rug Hug
Cancels: Frustration\par Frustration (V7)\par I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee

Lore: Ever since Lando's 'little' maneuver at the Battle of Taanab, his piloting skills had become legendary.
Gametext: If Han or your Lando is piloting a starfighter which is defending a battle at a system, add one battle destiny (add two if starfighter is \ul Falcon\ul0). Also, starfighter is immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
Information: People often want to re-enact Star Wars' fantastic epic space battles in the card game. The Light Side often struggles against the overwhelming power of the Imperial Armada's Star Destroyers. Cunning, daring maneuvers, and a little bit of luck saved the Rebellion in the movies. In the game, it takes all those things and intelligent management of interrupts.\par \par Punch It! is a vicious interrupt that you should use if the Dark Side isn't wary, particularly when you spring it on him as he is trying to clear away ships. Play Captain Han and Lando on the Falcon with some Corvettes, and wait for your opponent to become smug with Vader on the Executor. The two extra destiny from this, plus the extra destiny from Captain Han and a destiny for ability of 4, adds 4 destiny draws to an already formidable Force.\par \par The card has an extra ability that's dangerous, too. With Captain Han on the Falcon, you can get him to the Death Star and sit and drain. If your opponent tries to battle you, you can play this card for the extra 2 destiny and for immunity to attrition. The destiny draws will boost your power somewhat, reducing your battle damage (which you could play It Could Be Worse to reduce even more). The Falcon, since it is immune to attrition, remains at the Death Star for the next turn.
Combo: Captain Han Solo + Luke + Falcon + Punch It! + Out of Nowhere + Don't Get Cocky

Lore: Lord Vader interceded between the trigger happy mercenary and his target.
Gametext: If one of your characters was just targeted by a weapon during battle, use 3 Force to cancel that targeting. OR Cancel Double Back or Res Luk Ra'auf.
Information: See Blaster Deflection for similar text.
Cancels: Targeting of a character by a weapon\par Double Back\par Res Luk Ra'auf

Lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.
Gametext: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Your medical droids and Bacta Tank 'patients' may deploy aboard for free.
Information: Medical droids are:\par \par 2-1B (Too-Onebee)\par 2-1B (Too-Onebee) (V4)\par FX-7 (Effex-Seven)

Lore: "Only your hatred can destroy me."
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle, you may do one of the following: Add one destiny to your total power only. OR If you have a character weapon present, select one opponent's character present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.

Lore: "When we find Jabba the Hutt and that bounty hunter, we'll contact you."
Gametext: During your control phase, use 1 Force to move any one of your [Cloud City] characters of ability > 1 to any [Jabba's Palace] location where you have presence. If moving to any Jabba's Palace site, this movement is free and you do not need presence.

Lore: "I know where Luke is."
Gametext: USED: If you have a character on Weather Vane, place that character on your Used Pile. LOST: Deploy one or more vehicles, starfighters and pilots (at normal use of the Force) as a 'react' to a cloud sector.

Gametext: Insert face up in your Reserve Deck. When Effect reaches top it is lost, along with all opponent's 'insert' cards there. Reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.) OR Deploy between two mobile sites. Opponent's characters may pass only if aboard a Lift Tube or opponent uses +1 Force each.

Lore: There are many different paths to becoming a Jedi, each with its own risks and consequences. A student must choose wisely.
Gametext: At the beginning of opponent's move phase, target an opponent's character alone at a mobile site and select an adjacent site. Opponent must choose to move target there for free (target cannot move for remainder of turn), lose target or lose 2 Force.
IsPulled: Captain Bewil

Lore: Using the power of the dark side, Vader caused Luke to lose his confidence and question his sense of direction.
Gametext: If a battle you won just ended at an interior site and you have a character of ability > 3 present there, relocate one opponent's character present to an adjacent site. (If on Cloud City, may relocate that character to Weather Vane instead.)

Lore: "R2-D2, you know better than to trust a strange computer."
Gametext: Target a location. Scomp links there cannot be used for remainder of turn. OR If opponent is about to scan or otherwise look through your hand (unless using Monnok), opponent continues but must lose 4 Force plus the card allowing the scan.
Information: Scrambled Transmission makes Shocking Information immune to Sense.\par -----\par At the moment, a lot of people are using variants of Mike Riboulet's Dark Sided Manipulator. This involves the opponent scanning your hand in many ways - including Onith and Scanning Crew. By having an Information up your sleeve, you can't cancel the scan but you can lose the card which allowed the scan and the DS lose 4 Force as well! If the opponent doesn't have any scanning cards in his deck, this card is not wasted - it's destiny 5, and a Used Interrupt which can be recycled with its other function. There is a DS version of this card, Shocking Revelation, but it's of much less value.\par \par \par This card provides defense against some very strong Premiere strategies that have thrived on the tournament scene. Also, it provides an easy way to cycle itself back into the Life Force and prevent Monnok from causing the damaging loss of doubles. This card can be played on any location, regardless of whether there is a scomp link on the location card.\par \par The five destiny can be cycled very easily, which is excellent for monitoring high destiny draws. Before this card, players would often have to rely on playing A Few Maneuvers or Dark Maneuvers, which also required a starfighter to be in play. The drawback is that the destiny number is slightly lower.\par \par The most obvious use of this card is to protect against Scanning Crew and M'iiyoom Onith. The loss of four Force, plus the card causing the scan can suggest to the opponent that searching should only be done in the case of true necessity. This will help the Light Side player climb out from underneath a couple of extremely strong lock down strategies.
IsPulled: Hopping Mad\par Scrambled Transmission
Combo: Shocking Information + Destiny adders
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par This card may only be played if a scomp link is on table (and able to be targeted). This card may target (or affect) a Scomp link aboard a starship or vehicle at a location. The second function of this Interrupt affects cards that peek at one, some or all of the cards in your hand.

Gametext: Target a location. Scomp links there cannot be used for remainder of turn. OR If opponent is about to scan or otherwise look through your hand (unless using Grimtaash), opponent continues but must lose 4 Force plus the card allowing the scan.

This card may target (or affect) a Scomp link aboard a starship or vehicle at a location. The second function of this Interrupt affects cards that peek at one, some or all of the cards in your hand.

Lore: Originally designed as a planetary defense craft. Uses restricted jamming technology, allowing it to appear out of nowhere. Contains many hidden armaments.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot (must be a bounty hunter) and 3 passengers. May deploy with a pilot as a 'react'. Immune to attrition < 5 if Boba Fett piloting. Has ship-docking capability.
Information: When Vader's Bounty (V6) on table Slave I is destiny +2 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny.\par -----\par Slave I personas are:\par \par Boba Fett In Slave I\par Boba Fett In Slave I (V6)\par Slave I\par Slave I (V7)

Lore: Luke got the shaft.
Gametext: Relocate a card from the top of any Deck or Pile to the bottom (without looking). OR If you have a droid at a Scomp link on Cloud City, cancel Into The Ventilation Shaft, Lefty. OR Use 3 Force to cause a character at Weather vane to be lost.

Lore: Warning: The Alderaanian Medical Association has determined that inhaling carbon-freezing smoke can be hazardous to your health.
Gametext: During a battle at a site, if you are about to draw a card for battle destiny, you may instead use the ability number of one of your characters involved in the battle.
Information: The advantage of 'replacing' a battle destiny draw with the ability number is that opponent may not cancel your 'draw' (because it is no draw).
Combo: Smoke Screen + any high-ability character

Lore: Luke's sudden reversal of fortune allowed him to turn the tables on Vader.
Gametext: During a battle at a site, just before drawing battle destiny, if opponent has less than double your total power, use 4 Force to switch your total power with opponent's. OR If both players just drew one battle destiny, use 1 Force to switch numbers.
Combo: Somersault + Electrobinoculars

Gametext: Deploy on a prison. When one of your troopers 'delivers' (imprisons) a captive here, you may search your Lost Pile, take any one card into hand and then lose this Effect (each captive may be 'delivered' only once until they are released or leave table).
Information: Prisons are:\par \par Cloud City: Security Tower\par Death Star: Detention Block Corridor\par Dungeon (Prison) (V13)\par Jabba's Palace: Dungeon\par Kessel: Spice Mines - Prison (V13)

Lore: Boba Fett shifted his attention from Han to the pursuing Jedi initiate. Luke was unaware until the last second that he was being targeted.
Gametext: Use 3 Force: Retarget an Interrupt or Utinni Effect which specifies a target to another appropriate target on the same side of the Force. OR Relocate any Effect (except those immune to Alter) deployed on a location to another appropriate location.
Information: Good against Nabrun Leids.
Counterpart: I Have A Bad Feeling About This
Combo: Surprise + Dark Waters\par The little known ability of Dark Waters to reduce Force drains makes it a fairly powerful card, especially if it can be used to follow your opponent's drains.\par -----\par Surprise + Death Mark\par Since many decks play with Han and Chewie, you can retarget the Death Mark to whoever happens to be farther away at the time.\par -----\par Surprise + Death Squadron\par The only thing that weakens this otherwise pretty good card is that the Rebellion tends to stay away from it. Well, with Surprise, you can bring the Squadron to them.

Lore: After working together for a long time, Lando and Lobot developed a speechless form of communication.
Gametext: If Lobot and your Lando are in a battle together, cancel one opponent's destiny draw immediately after it is revealed. OR use 4 Force to cancel Dark Deal.
Information: \par Cloud City is flooded with cards that work as teamwork cards do, but with different effects. The only true requirement to these cards is, they must be played where two "mains" are present. This adds to the popularity and strength of the main characters as a whole, especially for the Dark Side.\par \par Surreptitious Glance is easy to play with, simply because of Lobot's deployment restrictions. Chances are, he's going to appear where Lando is. With Surreptitious Glance, you can duplicate Tarkin's ability with Vader, canceling your opponent's destiny draw. The advantage is obvious. The Light Side has an edge, though. Kal'Falnl C'ndros lets you (semi-reliably) cancel your opponent's draws, since the Light Side tends to have better destiny draws. Unfortunately, recent rulings have weakened Kal when she is present with Tarkin. Captain Han Solo forces your opponent to re-draw a destiny. Understand, he might just draw a better destiny!\par \par You can use Surreptitious Glance as a safety net should any of these strategies fail. Saving this card for when you truly need it tests your patience, but you can't wait too long, as Lando and Lobot tend to die faster than other mains.\par \par It's sub-text also makes it extremely useful, cancelling the Dark Side version of Echo Base Operations, Dark Deal, which is ordinarily extremely hard to counter.
Cancels: One opponent's destiny draw.\par Dark Deal

Lore: It's the bottom of the ninth level of Cloud City. Vader steps up to the platform. Here's the delivery. . . oooh, he took a big cut there! The Force sure wasn't with him on that one!
Gametext: If opponent just used a lightsaber to target, draw one destiny and subtract that amount from opponent's weapon destiny. OR Cancel one Mostly Armless card just played. OR Cancel Dark Strike, End This Destructive Conflict or Focused Attack.
Information: This card can be used to augment the strength of the Light Side players characters during ground battles. It can be used in a variety of different defensive situations, and is a Used Interrupt. This can be a nice advantage as many of the cards that it cancels by title are Dark Side Lost Interrupts. It is also a nice advantage to have the defense from lightsabers recur throughout the course of the game.\par \par With the addition of a couple more relatively high ability Light Side character cards in Cloud City, subtracting one destiny from the total of a lightsaber draw may go a long way to making the Light Side safe from marauding Dark Side saber users. Also, since Swing-And-A-Miss has three dots, it may be played at three separate times throughout the course of a turn, protecting from lightsaber swings as well as some of the Dark Side's nastier battle related interrupts from the Cloud City set.\par \par In battle heavy Cloud City playtesting, this card led to one of my favorite exchanges of quotes as the Dark Side player used Mostly Armless accompanied by the Pythonian quote "Your arms off", to which the Light player responded "No it isn't," when they played Swing-And-A-Miss.
Rules: This Interrupt subtracts from the total weapon destiny for a lightsaber, not from an individual destiny draw.
Cancels: Dark Strike\par End This Destructive Conflict\par Focused Attack\par Mostly Armless\par Sniper & Dark Strike

Lore: Vader thought that by capturing Luke, he would crush the Alliance's last hope. But, there was another...
Gametext: If Luke was just 'frozen,' deploy on Emperor or Detention Block Corridor. Target Luke and Vader. When reached by targets, place Utinni Effect on Luke and opponent must lose half of Life Force (round down). If Luke released, lose Utinni Effect. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: When a slam-bang card like The Emperor's Prize comes along, jaws drop. It will hack off half your opponent's Force, unless it takes you so long to pull it off that there's not much left. So speed it up. You'll find the cards you need to inflict massive damage in most Bounty or Carbon Freezing decks.\par \par First, get Docking Bay Control Room into play. It lets you spit out every Docking Bay in your deck, including those for Cloud City and the Death Star.\par \par Starting with the Detention Block Corridor or Carbonite Chamber is good too.\par \par Second, weasel your opponent into playing Luke. Play Mii'yoom Onith and conveniently forget to use her for a couple of turns. See if your opponent puts Luke out. Or start early with a Scanning Crew philosophy, and see if that brings Luke out to play. When Luke is on the table, the number one rule is: don't kill him unless you have a We Have A Prisoner in your hand. You can afford to take some losses in this effort, you'll be doing a whole lot more later on.\par \par Third, get Luke frozen. Whether this means jacking up a Force drain at the Carbonite Chamber, and then pushing him in with All Too Easy, or going the long route and capturing him, and then Carbon Freezing him, Luke has to be frozen.\par \par Fourth, and this is what you have to stock up for, put out the Prize, and make sure it and the frozen Luke are well protected. Make sure you have a steady stream of characters escorting Luke so that he's never alone. He'll be frozen for the rest of the game, but you don't want your opponent piling up with him. You'll also want to keep pesky rebels out of the Detention Block Corridor. This will make your life a whole lot easier.\par \par This card's problem is actually getting Luke to the Detention Block Corridor after he's Frozen. There just isn't too much mobility in the game for interior sites, except for the card that could save your life. Lift Tube is a Premiere common that rarely sees use, but, if your plans are centered around the two systems with mobile sites, Lift Tubes can be invaluable. It can carry four passengers, more than enough for Luke and some protection, and, since both docking bays are Mobile sites, it can move through the Docking Bay, although you shouldn't need it on the Death Star.\par \par After that, you're set. Half of your opponent's Life Force is gone, and you'll have a nice little force with which to Force drain. It seems like a very hefty task, and it will probably take up most of your time simply trying to pull it off. Once you do, however, you notice quickly that is was all worthwile.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par Utinni! (V2)\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: The Emperor's Prize + Vader's Bounty\par Not only do you deal massive amounts of damage, but you also retrieve a hefty amount of Force as well. As long as Vader is nearby, which he should be if you want to keep Luke unharmed, you can regain a lot of the loss that you'll take in setting up this combination.

Lore: It took escape from Hoth, asteroids, slugs, capture, refreshments with Vader, torture and the inevitable carbon-freezing to get Leia to reveal her true feelings for Han.
Gametext: If Han and Leia are together in a battle you just lost, forfeit one of them to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you. OR If Han is a captive and a battle was just initiated where you have Leia (or vice versa), add one battle destiny. OR Cancel This Is Still Wrong.

Lore: Han: 2. Luke: 2. Chewie: 0.
Gametext: If a battle was just initiated where opponent has a female targeted by This Is Just Wrong, add one battle destiny. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take one This Is Just Wrong into hand and reshuffle. OR Cancel This Is More Like It.
Pulls: This Is Just Wrong
IsCanceledBy: This Is Absolutely Right\par This Is Even Better

Lore: One of the many Cloud City miners who are willingly employed by greedy corporations exploiting planetary atmospheres. Unconcerned with environmental repercussions.
Gametext: When at a site, adds 1 to your Force drains at related cloud sectors. Also, during your activate phase, if at a Cloud City site and you control Bespin: Cloud City, may \b cumulatively\b0  activate 1 Force for every cloud sector on Bespin.
Combo: Tibanna Gas Miner + Bespin: Cloud City\par Adds one to the Force drain at Bespin: Cloud City.

Lore: Long-time Cloud City resident Willow Hood. Employed by a mining company which is sympathetic to the Rebels and sells them Tibanna gas at a discount.
Gametext: When at a site, adds 1 to your Force drains at related cloud sectors. Also, during your activate phase, if at a Cloud City site and you control Bespin: Cloud City, may \b cumulatively\b0  activate 1 Force for every cloud sector on Bespin.
IsPulled: Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
Combo: Tibanna Gas Miner + Bespin: Cloud City\par Adds one to the Force drain at Bespin: Cloud City.

Lore: Several TIEs were assigned to patrol Cloud City prior to the Imperial occupation of Bespin. Their instructions were to herd any vessels attempting to escape toward the Executor.
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a Force drain at a system, cloud sector or asteroid sector, you may 'react' by deploying TIEs and pilots to that location (at normal use of the Force).

Lore: Lutrillian. Primary saleswoman and executive planner for Planet Dreams, Inc. Monitors production schedules and accounting. Really enjoys making a sales pitch.
Gametext: During your control phase, may 'sell' one Interrupt card from hand. Opponent must use X Force, where X = destiny of that card or entire Force Pile (opponent's choice). Place sold card on opponent's Used Pile and activate X Force.
Combo: Treva Home + Draw Their Fire\par If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)

Lore: An assault of stormtroopers caused Leia, Chewie and Lando to retreat. When working together, the troopers' powerful onslaught can appear unstoppable.
Gametext: If a battle was just initiated at a site, each of your troopers present is power +2 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
Information: This card gives a shot in the arm to trooper decks. With this card and a couple of little tricks can allow troopers to be competitive in a number of different environments. Of course, the key to this deck is protecting the Trooper Assaults from Sense. Seven or eight Controls and a couple of Tentacles might be the advisable course of action for this mission.\par \par This deck can revolve around the classic Force drain locations such as the Moisture Farm, Judland Wastes, Cantina and Defensive Perimeter. Control of the location can be established with about 4 Imperial Trooper Guards. With a Trooper Assault in hand, these guys are power 24 and immune to attrition. If more characters show up for the Light Side, a few more guards can be thrown into the mix and they all add six power each.\par \par This is great for defending these locations, but of course doesn't do much for the attack. This is where another card can come in handy. Deploy Trooper Davin Felth or an Imperial Squad Leader and give them a Light Repeating Blaster Rifle and a power source. Blasted Droid will then allow the trooper to fire the LRBR with a destiny bonus pretty much until the Dark Side runs out of Reserve Deck. If the power source is a Portable Fusion Generator and the trooper is at the Moisture Farm or Defensive Perimeter, all of the shots will be at weapon destiny + three. Even Obi-Wan is fairly likely to run into a 4 destiny Trooper Assault from the Reserve Deck, wiping him out. And since the Imperial Trooper Guards are destiny 3, Son Of Skywalker can be hit when they are drawn using the LRBR add all of it's adders. Again, this combination needs protection from Sense.

Lore: Corrupt captain of the Cloud City Wing Guard. Began working during the administration of Baron Raynor. Easily bribed. Keeps the peace through intimidation.
Gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City, but may move elsewhere. Power +2 when participating in a battle you initiate. Opponent may use 2 Force to 'bribe' (exclude) Blendin from battle.
Information: He looks pretty weak...after all, your opponent can make Blendin not battle just by using two Force. And, admittedly, you probably don't want Blendin to be the focus of your deck, because of his unreliability. But Trooper Jerrol Blendin can help you make a few key moves and give you the advantage you need.\par \par The first thing to look at is Blendin's deploy cost -- he doesn't have one! That isn't a bad thing. And, if you initiate battle, he gets +2 power (4 total). He can be great for catching an opponent who doesn't keep anything in his Force Pile. For zero Force you can get +4 power in a battle and, effectively, increase the damage to your opponent by four. And, when the battle's over, you can forfeit Blendin to ensure that you don't get burned by his detrimental game text.
IsPulled: General Tagge (V2)
Combo: Blendin + Trooper Assault + Trooper Charge : Power *8* if you initiate the battle, all at the cost of zero Force! Makes a great surprise for your opponent in a 'react' deck.\par \par Blendin + Lone Warrior : Leave him alone at a site and give him defensive cards. Then, if your opponent chooses not to let him participate in a battle, the battle is just cancelled.

Lore: Imzig Cloud City trooper and Wing Guard \b leader\b0. Attempts to protect Cloud City citizens from less reputable members of local constabulary. Never accepts a bribe.
Gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City, but may move elsewhere. Deploys free to same Cloud City site as Lando. Power +2 when defending a battle. Your other Cloud City troopers are forfeit +2 where present.
Information: Looking for a boost for that Lobot Cloud City Trooper deck? Make sure you have Trooper Utris M'Toc stocked in your deck, ready to serve.\par \par Trooper Utris M'Toc is a power 2 ability 2 character with a destiny of 2. If Lobot is present at a site, M'Toc would deploy for free as a Cloud City trooper. He also deploys free to the same site as Lando. This works with either the Dark Lando or even the Light Lando, so it could be an effective way to ambush the Dark Side Lando. He is power +2 when defending a battle, so that could be a nasty surprise for the Dark Side if they choose to attack. When present with M'Toc, all of your other Cloud City Troopers are forfeit +2, allowing you to suck up more damage in a fight.\par -----\par Your Cloud City Troopers deploy free and are power +1 at same site as Lobot at a Cloud City site.\par -----\par Cloud City troopers are:\par \par Cloud City Trooper\par Sergeant Edian\par Trooper Utris M'Toc
IsPulled: Princess Organa
Combo: Trooper Utris M'Toc + Any Lando, or Lobot. M'Toc deploys for free.\par -----\par Trooper Utris M'Toc + Lobot + Cloud City Trooper. A powerful force with a cheap deploy cost.

Lore: Ugnaught assigned to determine how to use carbon-freezing on humans. Placed in charge of the Ugnaught workers on Cloud City. Formerly enslaved by humans.
Gametext: Power +2 at Trash Compactor, Droid Junkheap, Incinerator or Carbonite Chamber. Functions as a leader if present with another Ugnaught. Where present, other Ugnaughts are forfeit +2 and double their bonus to Carbon-Freezing destiny.
Information: Here is another one of the Carbon-Freezing enhancers from Cloud City. This is the card that will allow the Dark Side to play with only three to five non-unique ugnaughts in their deck, and still have a relatively decent chance of pulling off freezing.\par \par The power +2 bonus is nice, but not really why this character is on the table. Another small, but nice feature is that if pressed into service, Ugloste is a warrior that can be armed and sent out with a We Have A Prisoner in hand to go and do the capture work to get a potential freezing candidate. The bonus that he gives to the other Ugnaughts with him gives the Dark Side a decent chance of coming out of the battle without too much trouble. With the added bonus from Prepare The Chamber to battles, they may even be a force to be reckoned with.\par \par The real advantage of this guy is that he doubles the additions by the Ugnaughts, making freezing a real possibility when taken in conjunction with other cards such as Prepare The Chamber and Carbonite Chamber Console.
IsPulled: Carbonite Chamber Console

Lore: Cheap manual labor from Gentes in the Anoat system. Make up Cloud City's second largest population. Responsible for maintenance and menial chores throughout the city.
Gametext: When at Carbonite Chamber, \b cumulatively\b0  adds 1 to each Carbon-Freezing destiny draw. During your control phase, may lose 1 Force from hand to search your Lost Pile and take one weapon or device into hand.
Information: Here is an answer for everybody that wants to know how to draw more than 10 for Carbon-Freezing destiny. Much in the way that Death Star Gunners and Rebel Techs are necessary to make a Commence Primary Ignition or Attack Run deck go, these little guys are the key to making Rebels 'well preserved'. The Ugnaught advantage though, is that there are some other cards that allow them to play a more useful role.\par \par Obviously, their prime purpose in the game is to pull off Carbon-Freezing. To do this, they each add one. Throw in Ugloste and this bonus just soars. What should not be overlooked is the ability to sacrifice a card to go and get a few things to facilitate the freezing process. This means that you can lose the key cards to the freezing process early, knowing that you can get them back later in the game. Get the Carbonite Chamber Console and not only do you get the bonus to freezing destiny, but suddenly more Ugnaughts, and even the Carbon-Freezing effect itself show up. Prepare The Chamber also helps both the destiny draw, and the Ugnaughts themselves.\par \par Another advantage to these guys is that they can help outfit your bounty hunting crew. Who wouldn't lose two Force to give IG-88 a Light Repeating Blaster Rifle an a Portable Fusion Generator. Give him some Binders and he can do all the collection work for you. Also, with Ugloste, Ugnaughts provide a decent little fighting force on their own, especially with Prepare The Chamber.
Pulls: On weapon from Lost Pile.\par On device from Lost Pile.
IsPulled: Carbonite Chamber Console
Combo: Ugnaughts + Prepare The Chamber + Carbonite Chamber Console + Ugloste\par A guaranteed freezing draw.\par -----\par Ugnaughts + weapons + bounty hunters. These guys can serve as the ultimate armorers. You don't have to worry about hanging on to combinations of weapon cards until you actually have the warriors to use them.

Lore: The rage of the Dark Lord.
Gametext: Deploy on Vader. He is power +2, but neither adds 1 to battle destiny nor allows Tarkin to cancel destiny. Opponent loses 2 Force at end of each of opponent's turns in which Vader did not battle and you had a character of ability > 3 on table. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: This card is a must in decks that intend to confront the Dark Side in a direct confrontation at sites. Uncontrollable Fury could also be useful at systems, but the benefits of Vader (especially when combined with Tarkin) are not quite as powerful at systems and sectors due to the fact the Light Side cannot lose the forfeit value of cards due to Vader and his lightsaber while in space.\par \par Since the Premiere edition of the game, Light Side players have been searching for a way to counter the deadly combination of Grand Moff Tarkin and Darth Vader. Some solutions that have worked to one extent or another have been Demotion, Tarkin Seeker and playing space decks. An opinion that some top ranked players hold is that Vader is wasted in space when compared with his devastating effectiveness at sites. Uncontrollable Fury is another tool in this war. While there is a Dark Side card that can cancel it, the power of Uncontrollable Fury probably makes it more than worth the risk.\par \par There are numerous avoidance strategies that can make use of the Force loss part of the card. The easiest of these is just to use Nabrun Leids to move away from Vader in each of the Dark Side's battle phases, and cause them to lose two Force per opponent's turn. Of course, that requires the Dark player to use Vader, but he is usually to good to pass up.\par -----\par Dark side card against direct damage: Imperial Decree (V6).
IsPulled: Clash Of Sabers\par It's Not My Fault (V)\par Rycar Ryjerd (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: "We would be honored if you would join us."
Gametext: Deploy on a Rebel of ability > 2. If subsequently captured by a bounty hunter and then transferred to a prison where Vader is present, retrieve Force equal to character's forfeit (+4 if Luke) and lose Effect. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Prisons are:\par \par Cloud City: Security Tower\par Death Star: Detention Block Corridor\par Dungeon (Prison) (V13)\par Jabba's Palace: Dungeon\par Kessel: Spice Mines - Prison (V13)
IsPulled: Boba Fett (CC) (V6)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: A symbol of the Dark Lord of the Sith, and of the seductive power of the dark side.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on one of your Imperials or aliens. Immune to attrition < 5. When in battle, adds 1 to each of your battle destiny draws.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: "I promise." "Auuuuuug!"
Gametext: Deploy Han to same site as Chewie or your Lando (regardless of location deployment restrictions). OR If Chewie and your Lando are in a battle together, subtract 3 from attrition against you (cannot fall below zero). OR Cancel I Had No Choice.
IsPulled: Chewbacca (V3)
Cancels: I Had No Choice\par I Had No Choice (V6)

Lore: "He doesn't want you at all, he's after somebody called, uh...Skywalker." "Luke?" "Lord Vader has set a trap for him." "And we're that bait!" "Yeah, well, he's on his way."
Gametext: Deploy on Han, Leia or Chewie if captured or 'frozen.' Target Luke. Luke may not attempt Jedi Tests. Also, during each of opponent's draw phases, opponent loses 2 Force (3 if captive is 'frozen'). Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par Utinni! (V2)\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par This Utinni Effect may target Luke even if he is on Dagobah (as implied by the Jedi Test restriction). We're The Bait is canceled if the captive or frozen character it is deployed on is released.

Lore: Vader confiscated Han's blaster, his ship, his Wookiee, his girl and his only hope of escape.
Gametext: USED: Search your Used Pile, take one weapon into hand and reshuffle. LOST: If a battle was just initiated, one of your characters of ability > 3 present may 'steal' one character weapon present.
Information: When using this card as a Used Interrupt, you may search your Used Pile. Doesn't sound overly interesting. However, after deploying something like an Executor, or a normal star destroyer with pilots, you should have an interesting Used Pile. If you have plenty weapons in your deck, chances are good that you find a weapon there. This is also a very strong point, as you can take ONE weapon. It does not specify which weapon. Find a Superlaser there ? Take it. Vader needs his custom slice-toy and it's in the Used Pile ? Pick out Vader's Lightsaber and take it into your hand. Want to arm that star destroyer ? Weapon Levitate the Turbolaser Battery or Ion Cannon you see in your Used Pile. The possibilities are only limited by the weapons in your deck.\par \par There is another use, the Lost Interrupt variant. For fun I'll give an example which actually happened. I had an unarmed Darth Vader at a site. Here comes Obi-Wan with a generic Jedi Lightsaber (his own toy was not deployed yet). Obi starts to battle and suddenly he feels the lightsaber wrenched from his grip, sees it flying through the room and into Darth Vaders hands. The last thing Obi-Wan ever saw, was Darth Vader slicing him with Obi's own surrogate toy.\par \par In the game, Obi-Wan started the battle and I played Weapon Levitation as a Lost Interrupt. I snatched the Jedi Lightsaber and, as it can be used by any warrior, used it to slice Obi-Wan to ribbons. However, things get a little more interesting. The game text states, that you may 'steal' one character weapon present. OK, so you will not run off with a Planet Defender Ion Cannon. However, did you see Luke waving his Blaster Pistol (and you fear he will target you, to make Darth lose the immunity to attrition) ? 'Steal' the pistol. It is a character weapon. Do you see Djas Puhr against a Light Side character with a Blaster Rifle and your opponent starts the fight ? Use Weapon Levitation to 'steal' the rifle. You see, the great part is, that neither specific weapons, nor specific characters are mentioned. Any character of ability >3 can steal any character weapon (so you might even get a weapon back thet the Light Side once stole from you !).\par \par In short, a good card to include in any deck, especially if you have a lot of weapons, a lot of ability 4+ characters, ... or both.\par \par Strong points:\par * Weapon Levitation = Destiny 4 - good to upgrade average destiny, good to draw destiny.\par * Weapon Levitation = Two cards for the price of one (Used and Lost variant).\par * Weapon Levitation = Uncommon, thus it should not be too hard to get.\par * Weapon Levitation = Surprise, as in, surprise your opponent by using his weapons against him, or at least get your weapons fast.\par \par \par Weak points:\par * Weapon Levitation = Not immune, so a Sense could ruin this little plan.\par * Weapon Levitation = Unique. You can't search a weapon, not find it and then use a second Weapon Levitation to 'steal' in one turn.
Pulls: One weapon from Used Pile.
Combo: Weapon Levitation  Control = Who said anything about 'Sense' ?\par -----\par Weapon Levitation + opponent's Polarized Negative Power Coupling = You SEE your Used Pile, you know what cards go there.\par -----\par Weapon Levitation + many weapon cards in your deck = many weapons on the table fast, destiny 4 card recycled each time.\par -----\par Weapon Levitation + many characters of ability >3 = You do not need your own weapons if you have enough Weapon Levitations.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par You may not initiate a Weapon Levitation (Lost function) if the stealing character is incapable of "carrying" a weapon. For example, a B'omarr Monk, or a Disarmed character.

Lore: When Vader dueled Luke at Cloud City, he fought a son trained by his former master and a weapon constructed by his former self.
Gametext: USED: If a lightsaber was just used to enhance a Force drain, place it in owner's Used Pile. LOST: Place any or all of your devices and character weapons on table in your Used Pile.
Information: A unique Used or Lost Interrupt with a 5 destiny, using one of these in a deck helps to make weapons and devices less card-intensive to make use of. First, the Used function plays when a lightsaber was just used to enhance a Force drain, and puts that lightsaber into the owner's Used Pile. This is very obnoxious to do after Mara or Son Of Skywalker has used their "once per game" ability. Putting an opponent's lightsaber into the Used Pile is beneficial since it takes away the Force drain bonus for the following turn, and it removes the battle / duel advantage that a saber provides. Also, late in the game, you can put one of your lightsabers into your Used Pile to help boost your differential. As a Lost Interrupt, this works even better for this purpose, as you may place any or all of your devices and character weapons on table into your Used Pile. These counterparts are a must in any deck utilizing a quantity of devices and character weapons, and allows them to be used without the disadvantage of being too card-intensive. For a funny Light Side combo, put a bunch on high destiny devices into the Used Pile while Descent Into The Dark is out, then battle or Surprise Assault.

Lore: Not a good place to hang around.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Any character here may be captured or rescued by a player's starship or vehicle controlling Cloud City during that player's control phase. Character here lost if new character arrives. Effect lost if Cloud City lost. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Heart Of The Chasm\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par We're The Bait (V6)
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par If an escort is about to be relocated to a Weather Vane, any captives that character is escorting are released.

Lore: The metal rods extending from the bottom of Cloud City are part of the city's flotation system. Sensors detect the velocity of wind and the content of local clouds.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Any character here may be captured or rescued by a player's starship or vehicle controlling Cloud City during that player's control phase. Character here lost if new character arrives. Effect lost if Cloud City lost. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par -----\par This is a card that adds a lot of strategy and fun to the Cloud City set. While you're battling on Cloud City, there is always the danger of your characters being thrown into a ventilation shaft and winding up dangling from a small metal rod below the city.\par \par Since there's only room for one on that rod, it's really in your best interest to control the Bespin: Cloud City sector, and get your characters out of there as fast as possible. Otherwise, the next person to get thrown (or to voluntarily jump) off of a catwalk is going to knock your character into the clouds below.
IsPulled: Fall Of The Legend\par It's Not My Fault (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par If an escort is about to be relocated to a Weather Vane, any captives that character is escorting are released.

Lore: Lacking foresight, Luke suffered the consequences of rushing into battle unprepared.
Gametext: USED: Cancel Noble Sacrifice, Gift Of The Mentor or Old Ben. LOST: If Luke is defending a battle, draw one destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero).
Information: The Dark Side often has a problem with farmboy Luke and friends playing interrupts to enhance destiny draws. From Gift of the Mentor to Skywalkers, the Light Side has plenty of interrupts to throw at you. There are times when you just plain don't have enough Senses and Alters to take care of the job. So, what do you do?\par \par There are a number of what we like to call "tension" cards that the Dark Side may use to its advantage. These cards show relationships between Light Side characters at vulnerable moments. Scruffy Looking Nerf Herder is the first and best-known of these tension cards. In Scruffy Looking Nerf Herder, Leia and Han's usual strong bond hits a weak spot and allows the Dark Side to draw two destiny and to subtract that amount from the Light Side opponent's attrition and total power.\par \par Since every Light Side deck uses Luke in one form or another, including a card to counter an opponent using one of the personas of Luke is a good idea. Why Didn't You Tell Me? cancels Gift Of The Mentor and the popular Force regeneration card, Noble Sacrifice. It's a rare game when Yoda doesn't bite the big one because of Noble Sacrifice (gaining the Light Side 9 Force!), so canceling it is good idea.\par \par In a battle against Luke, Why Didn't You Tell Me can hamper your opponent significantly. Some of the Light Side strategies deal with simply deploying a main character, and trying to chip away at the an opposing vehicle, character, or starship, and hope that the other cards' Forfeit guides them through the Force loss. With a good destiny draw, this hope can be at least stemmed, as those cards battle destiny dwindles from a five or six to a mere one or two. Not a problem, simply add another counter to your Septoid Droid.
Combo: Why Didn't You Tell Me? + cheap characters of 2 Power, such as DS-61-2 = One of the more annoying things that happens in a game is when your opponent notices you've played a 2 Power pilot and sacrifices Yoda. Why Didn't You Tell Me? gets rid of that fairly easily.
Cancels: Gift Of The Mentor\par Noble Sacrifice\par Old Ben

Lore: A Snivvian on Cloud City, working for Planet Dreams, Inc. Terraforms asteroids, creating habitable atmospheres. Responsible for the aesthetics of the created environments.
Gametext: Power +1 if with Zutton. During your control phase, may use 1 Force to place one asteroid sector from hand onto Used Pile, search Reserve Deck, take one site into hand and reshuffle.
Pulls: One site when placing one asteroid sector onto Used Pile.

Lore: Wookiees have been known to dislocate more than just arms.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to target an opponent's non-droid character present with one of your Wookiees. Both players draw destiny. Add ability and power. Target lost if Wookiee's total destiny > target's total destiny.
Information: This interrupt from Cloud City has the potential to give you an advantage in certain situations... That is, if you have a Wookiee around to grab your opponent's non-droid characters by the throat.\par \par For instance, say your opponent has Davin Felth and two Stormtroopers at the Death Star Docking Bay, where you have Chewbacca and Lando Calrissian present. Your opponent's total power is four and ability is four (therefore a battle destiny), while your total power is eight and ability is five (also a battle destiny). Because your opponent draws a battle destiny, chances are that you will have to forfeit either of your characters. However, if Chewbacca Wookiee Strangles a Stormtrooper first, your opponent will not be able to draw battle destiny anymore and since you still do, you will probably be able to cause a lot of battle damage.\par \par Wookiee Strangle is also just good for eliminating annoying characters such as the not-so-good doctor himself, Dr.Evazan, and even your opponent's Undercover Spies! Bye-Bye Garindan and Labria, you should never upset a Wookiee. :)\par \par Although Wookiee Strangle isn't always successful, most of the time it is...thanks to Chewbacca's biceps. There are just a few characters that can take Chewbacca on in Star Wars CCG. They are: Darth Vader, Kitik Keed'kak, Grand Moff Tarkin, and Boba Fett (CC). Stay away from these characters, and you should have no trouble at all.
IsPulled: Chewbacca (V3)
Combo: Wookiee Strangle + any Chewbacca + Chewbacca's Bowcaster + Sorry About The Mess\par Your opponent has two characters less than he started the turn with - in your control phase.

Lore: "It is useless to resist. Don't let yourself be destroyed as Obi-Wan did."
Gametext: Use 2 Force to target a character present with your warrior with a lightsaber. Target cannot move or battle until end of your next turn. OR Use 1 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take one I Am Your Father into hand and reshuffle. OR Cancel Uncontrollable Fury.
Information: You Are Beaten is one of those multi-use cards that is probably mostly used for only one of it's abilities while the other one is completely forgotten. It is the only card which cancels Uncontrollable Fury (one of the best cards from Cloud City, in my opinion, I won two games in a tournament because of it), but it's other ability can also be a game breaker.\par \par For example...your opponent is draining at the Cantina for two...oh let's say three, you deployed a Presence Of The Force early and lost control of the location...no, make that four, he has Obi deployed there with HIS saber...no, okay five, Luke is there with Anakin's Saber...oh by the way, he played a Lightsaber Proficiency on his last turn...look, Billy, that's a drain for six every control phase!!! You have a Vader and Vader's Saber in your hand, but aren't sure if you can beat Obi, Luke, Han, and Kal'Fnal Cndros (yep he's there too) with Vader, Ozzel, and Veers (by the way, they're in your hand too). Oh my goodness, you have a YOU ARE BEATEN in your hand!!!\par \par Things are looking MUCH better, you have a lot of Force to use, so you deploy Vader, his Saber, Ozzel, and Veers, then activate that one more that commits you to do battle with your nemeses. Oh wait...what are those other Force there for? YOU ARE BEATEN!!!!! Target OBI, oh, my dear, what's that? Obi CAN'T PARTICIPATE IN THE BATTLE OR MOVE until the end of your NEXT turn. It helps a little, don't ya see? Oh and the other use, if you're playing with I AM YOUR FATHER in your deck, is to go through and grab it after you beat down Luke's happy butt and cause your opponent to lose two MORE Force every turn and Luke won't stand much of a chance against Vader anymore.
Pulls: I Am Your Father\par I Am Your Father (V6)
IsCanceledBy: Impressive, Most Impressive (V7)\par Strike Blocked\par Twilight Is Upon Me (unless canceling Uncontrollable Fury)\par Weapon Levitation
